page.title: 08Landscape, Scoutmoor.
page.content: The landscape of Scoutmoor is predominantly hilly, and quite steep in places. It is mainly desolate moorland made up of poor rough grazing vegetation for rearing sheep. This is broken by many dry stone walls and a number of streams, one of which trickles by the{Rossendale Way } footpath, on the summit of the moor, another of which flows through a small valley lower down. At the top of the moor is the {Scoutmoor High Level Reservoir}which was built by the Bury District Joint Water Board between 1903 and 1910 and is dated 1909. Over looking the main road through Turn Village is a large stone quarry.Lower down is a water treatment works which has been surrounded by a man made coniferous forest.
